Maze.q5wrong: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
Maze.q10wrong: No - Try tracking my direction while following the program.
Maze.turnTooltip: Turns me left or right by 90 degrees.
Maze.ifTooltip: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do some actions.
Maze.ifelseTooltip: If there is a path in the specified direction, then do the first block of actions. Otherwise, do the second block of actions.
Maze.whileTooltip: Repeat the enclosed actions until finish point is reached.
Maze.capacity0: You have<x id='START_SPAN'/>0<x id='END_SPAN'/> blocks left.
Maze.capacity1: You have <x id='START_SPAN'/>1<x id='END_SPAN'/> block left.
Maze.capacity2: You have <x id='START_SPAN'/>%1<x id='END_SPAN'/> blocks left.
Maze.nextLevel: Congratulations! You have completed this level.
Maze.finalLevel: Congratulations! You have solved the final level.
Maze.oneTopBlock: On this level, you need to stack together all of the blocks in the white workspace.

Apps.hashError: Sorry, '%1' doesn't correspond with any saved Blockly file.
Apps.xmlError: Could not load your saved file.  Perhaps it was created with a different version of Blockly?
Maze.hint1: Use only the blocks you need to get to complete the level.
Maze.hint3: Try using the repeat block so you can complete the level with only 2 blocks.
Maze.hint9: Use two 'if' statements so I can move left and right when needed.
Maze.hint11: This level requires only four blocks if you use an if-else block.
Maze.reinfMsg2: A repeat block repeats the blocks inside it until I reach the red marker.
Maze.reinfMsg3: You have just written some programs. Good job!
Maze.reinfMsg4: Which direction am I facing after this program ends?
Maze.reinfMsg5: Here is an if block: I will turn left if there is a path to the left.
Maze.reinfMsg6: We can place 'if' blocks inside 'repeat' blocks. Where am I when this program ends? Click on the correct picture below.
Maze.reinfMsg7: Repeat blocks allow me to do an action multiple times without additional blocks. 'if' blocks allow me to do an action based on my surroundings.
Maze.reinfMsg9: Here is an 'if-else' block: I move forward if there is a path ahead, but I turn left if not.
Maze.reinfMsg10: Will the blocks below move me to the red marker?
Maze.instructions1: A program is a sequence of statements. Stack a couple of 'move forward' blocks together to help me reach the goal.
Maze.instructions2: Help me reach the end of this path.
Maze.instructions3: Computers have limited memory. Reach the end of this path using only two blocks.
Maze.instructions4: What should I do to follow this path?
Maze.instructions5: Reach the goal using only five blocks.
Maze.instructions6: I will have to turn left when I cannot go straight.
Maze.instructions7: An 'if' condition will do something only if the condition is true.  Try turning left if there is a path to the left.
Maze.instructions8: A small change to the blocks from the previous maze will solve this level.
Maze.instructions9: You can use more than one 'if' statement.
Maze.instructions10: Can you use the blocks you have learned to get me over the mountains?
Maze.instructions11: Use the 'if-else' block to help me get out of the maze!
